content:
TITLE: Downloading and Analyzing Remote Files with getID3() in PHP
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet demonstrates how to download a remote file over HTTP/FTP and analyze it with getID3(). It creates a temporary local copy of the file, analyzes it with getID3(), and then deletes the temporary file. The example also shows how to pass original filesize and filename for accurate analysis of partial downloads.
SOURCE: https://github.com/wordpress/wordpress/blob/master/wp-includes/ID3/readme.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: PHP
CODE:
```
// Copy remote file locally to scan with getID3()
$remotefilename = 'http://www.example.com/filename.mp3';
if ($fp_remote = fopen($remotefilename, 'rb')) {
	$localtempfilename = tempnam('/tmp', 'getID3');
	if ($fp_local = fopen($localtempfilename, 'wb')) {
		while ($buffer = fread($fp_remote, 32768)) {
			fwrite($fp_local, $buffer);
		}
		fclose($fp_local);

		$remote_headers = array_change_key_case(get_headers($remotefilename, 1), CASE_LOWER);
		$remote_filesize = (isset($remote_headers['content-length']) ? (is_array($remote_headers['content-length']) ? $remote_headers['content-length'][count($remote_headers['content-length']) - 1] : $remote_headers['content-length']) : null);

		// Initialize getID3 engine
		$getID3 = new getID3;

		$ThisFileInfo = $getID3->analyze($localtempfilename, $remote_filesize, basename($remotefilename));

		// Delete temporary file
		unlink($localtempfilename);
	}
	fclose($fp_remote);
}
```

TITLE: Applying LGPL License Notice to Source Files
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to apply the LGPL license notice to source files of a library. It includes placeholders for the library name, copyright year, and author name, as well as the standard LGPL text.
SOURCE: https://github.com/wordpress/wordpress/blob/master/wp-includes/js/tinymce/license.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: plaintext

modify it under the terms of the GNU Lesser General Public

version 2.1 of the License, or (at your option) any later version.

This library is distributed in the hope that it will be useful,

TITLE: Implementing Genericons Font-Face in CSS
DESCRIPTION: CSS code that defines the @font-face rule for loading the Genericons webfont in various formats. This snippet shows how to properly reference the font files in your stylesheet directory.
SOURCE: https://github.com/wordpress/wordpress/blob/master/wp-content/themes/twentyfourteen/genericons/README.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: CSS
CODE:
```
@font-face {
    font-family: 'Genericons';
    src: url('font/genericons-regular-webfont.eot');
    src: url('font/genericons-regular-webfont.eot?#iefix') format('embedded-opentype'),
         url('font/genericons-regular-webfont.woff') format('woff'),
         url('font/genericons-regular-webfont.ttf') format('truetype'),
         url('font/genericons-regular-webfont.svg#genericonsregular') format('svg');
    font-weight: normal;
    font-style: normal;

}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Implementing Genericons Font-Face in CSS
DESCRIPTION: This CSS snippet defines the font-face for Genericons, specifying various font file formats for cross-browser compatibility. It sets up the font family 'Genericons' for use in web projects.
SOURCE: https://github.com/wordpress/wordpress/blob/master/wp-content/themes/twentythirteen/genericons/README.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: CSS
CODE:
```
@font-face {
    font-family: 'Genericons';
    src: url('font/genericons-regular-webfont.eot');
    src: url('font/genericons-regular-webfont.eot?#iefix') format('embedded-opentype'),
         url('font/genericons-regular-webfont.woff') format('woff'),
         url('font/genericons-regular-webfont.ttf') format('truetype'),
         url('font/genericons-regular-webfont.svg#genericonsregular') format('svg');
    font-weight: normal;
    font-style: normal;
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Extracting ID3 Metadata from Files in PHP
DESCRIPTION: A simple PHP function that extracts ID3v1 tag data from the end of a file. It uses unpack() to parse the 128-byte ID3v1 tag format which includes title, artist, album, year, comment, track number, and genre ID fields.
SOURCE: https://github.com/wordpress/wordpress/blob/master/wp-includes/ID3/readme.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: php
CODE:
```
function getID3($filename) { return unpack('a3TAG/a30title/a30artist/a30album/a4year/a28comment/c1track/c1genreid', substr(file_get_contents($filename), -128)); }
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating a Custom Icon with Genericons in CSS
DESCRIPTION: This CSS snippet demonstrates how to create a custom icon using Genericons. It uses the :before pseudo-element to insert the icon, sets its content using a Unicode value, and applies styling for proper display.
SOURCE: https://github.com/wordpress/wordpress/blob/master/wp-content/themes/twentythirteen/genericons/README.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: CSS
CODE:
```
.my-icon:before {
	content: '\f101';
	display: inline-block;
	-webkit-font-smoothing: antialiased;
	font: normal 16px/1 'Genericons';
	vertical-align: top;
}
```

Gnomovision comes with ABSOLUTELY NO WARRANTY; for details type `show w'.
This is free software, and you are welcome to redistribute it
under certain conditions; type `show c' for details.

TITLE: Optimized CSS @font-face Declaration for Genericons
DESCRIPTION: This CSS snippet shows an optimized @font-face declaration for loading Genericons without base64 encoding. It's useful when cross-origin font loading is not an issue and faster performance is desired.
SOURCE: https://github.com/wordpress/wordpress/blob/master/wp-content/themes/twentysixteen/genericons/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: CSS
CODE:
```
@font-face {
	font-family: 'Genericons';
		src: url('Genericons.woff') format('woff'),
		url('Genericons.ttf') format('truetype'),
		url('Genericons.svg#genericonsregular') format('svg');
	font-weight: normal;
	font-style: normal;
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Implementing Genericons Icon in CSS
DESCRIPTION: This CSS snippet demonstrates how to create an icon using Genericons. It sets the content property to the Unicode value of the desired icon and applies necessary styling for proper rendering.
SOURCE: https://github.com/wordpress/wordpress/blob/master/wp-content/themes/twentysixteen/genericons/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: CSS
CODE:
```
.my-icon:before {
	content: '\f101';
	font: normal 16px/1 'Genericons';
	display: inline-block;
	-webkit-font-smoothing: antialiased;
	-moz-osx-font-smoothing: grayscale;
}
```

TITLE: Configuring FontCustom for Genericons in YAML
DESCRIPTION: This YAML snippet is part of the fontcustom.yml file used to customize the font name and CSS selector when building Genericons with FontCustom. Users should edit these values before compiling.
SOURCE: https://github.com/wordpress/wordpress/blob/master/wp-content/themes/twentysixteen/genericons/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: YAML
CODE:
```

css_selector: .genericon
```

TITLE: Navigating to Theme Directory - Bash Command
DESCRIPTION: Command to navigate to the Twenty Nineteen theme directory in the WordPress installation.
SOURCE: https://github.com/wordpress/wordpress/blob/master/wp-content/themes/twentynineteen/contributing.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
cd /my-computer/local-wordpress-install/src/wp-content/themes/twentynineteen
```
